comments.C006: $C006 Addresses of subroutines to handle each token (-1)
comments.C0EA: $C0EA Search the stack until a ‘FOR’ entry is found.
comments.C448: $C448 Check an address against the top of memory
comments.C475: $C475 Warm start entry (does not clear program).
comments.C5F8: $C5F8 Wait for a keypress and return the ASCII code.
comments.C6E4: $C6E4 Find the address of a given line.
comments.D7F1: $D7F1 Calculate the length of a string and clear temporary strings.
comments.DD4D: $DD4D Move memory to the second accumulator.
comments.DDE5: $DDE5 Divide the second accumulator by the main accumulator.
comments.DE73: $DE73 Move memory to the main accumulator.
comments.DECD: $DECD Move the second accumulator to the main accumulator.
comments.DEDD: $DEDD Move the main accumulator to the second accumulator.
comments.DFCF: $DFCF Input a floating-point number from a string of ASCII characters.
comments.E0D1: $E0D1 Output a floating-point number into a string of ASCII characters.
comments.E231: $E231 Raise the second accumulator to the power of a number in memory.
comments.E554: $E554 Test for the end of a load from tape.
comments.E576: $E576 Print message at far left of top line.
comments.E6CA: $E6CA Change the 6522 ready for cassette I/0.
comments.E804: $E804 Reset the 6522 after the completion of tape I/0.
comments.F409: $F409 Output character from X register to screen.
comments.F436: $F436 Output message to top line at position X.
comments.F57B: $F57B Output character in A to the printer.
comments.F89B: $F89B Set up the ASCII character set.
comments.0012: Address of start of current line (in TEXT mode).
comments.0014: Used by the 8912 register load subroutine.
comments.0018: Used to point to the start of error messages.
comments.001A: Contains a jump to the routine which prints ‘Ready’.
comments.0028: The type of data which resulted from formula evaluation; 0 means numeric, #FF means a string.
comments.0029: A flag that indicates whether the last variable used was an integer.
comments.002A: A flag which is used in several places.
comments.0033: Various uses, but often used to store a line number that is being located.
comments.00A2: Pointer to next free string space.
comments.00A6: Highest available memory location available to BASIC.
comments.00AA: The current line number – saved for error messages.
comments.00AC: Address of the start of the current instruction – 1.
comments.00AE: Current DATA line number – used only when printing error messy ges.
comments.00B0: The address of the next DATA item – 1.
comments.00B4: The identity of the last variable used.
comments.00E8: The second part of the get-character routine.
comments.00FA: The current random number is stored here as a floating-point number
comments.0204: Used when checking the range of values used in sound and graphics commands.
comments.0208: Contains details of the last ordinary key pressed (but not the ASCII code).
comments.0209: Contains details about the last shift or control key pressed.
comments.020C: Caps lock. This contains either #7F or #FF – no other value will work!
comments.0212: Contains the HIRES FB flag to indicate whether to draw, erase, or invert.
comments.0213: The pattern register is stored here. You can POKE values here instead of using the PATTERN command.
comments.021A: The HIRES cursor Y value (do not forget to alter #10 and #11 as well)
comments.021F: A graphics flag; 0 is TEXT, 1 is graphics.
comments.0228: Jump vector to the fast interrupt routine.
comments.022B: Jump vector to the non-maskable interrupt routine.
comments.0230: Jump vector to the slow interrupt routine.
comments.0268: Cursor position down the screen, relative to the start address of the screen.
comments.0272: Timer 1 (used for reading the keyboard). W274 – t275 – Timer 2 (used by the flashing cursor).
comments.0276: Timer 3 (used by WAIT, HIRES, and TEXT). #278 – #2BF – (version 1.0)
comments.02C0: Graphics enable: 0 means TEXT with GRAB, 1 means TEXT with RELEASE, and 3 means HIRES.
comments.02DF: The AS’CII code for the last key pressed (with top bit set).
comments.02E0: The parameter area for graphics and sound commands.
comments.02F1: Print flag – set to 128 to make all print go to the printer, 0 for it to go to the screen.
comments.02F2: A flag set by the EDIT command.
comments.02F7: (version 1.0 only). The inverse flag. Try out different values!
comments.02FB: A jump command to the & extension.
